hints.content:
### The standard circle equation

This is the standard circle equation:

>$(x-\blueD h)^2+(y-\greenD k)^2=\maroonC r^2$

In this form, the center of the circle is at $(\blueD h, \greenD k)$ and the radius is $\maroonC r$.

Therefore, the first thing we should do is rewrite the given equation in this form.

### Finding the center and the radius

This is the given equation written in standard form:

>$(x-(\blueD{-5}))^2+(y-(\greenD{-2}))^2=\maroonC{2}^2$

Therefore, the center of our circle is at $(\blueD{-5},\greenD{-2})$ and the radius is $\maroonC{2}$.

### Graphing the circle

The circle is graphed by dragging the center of the circle to $(\blueD{-5},\greenD{-2})$ and then dragging the outline so the radius is $\maroonC 2$.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/48428a2c66f35dd1a3cf288d0ea3cc7efad988d0)
